subject: General usage and test dependency issues
msgSnippet: Hi, I ve just started using jUnit and I m unsure how it should be used I m testing invoking a method on an object. I want to test that the method didn t throw
messageBody:
Hi, I've just started using jUnit and I'm unsure how it should be used
I'm testing invoking a method on an object. I want to test that the method
didn't throw any errors, and objects were added to several lists.
Do I
1) invoke the method in setUp and have methods testNoErrors,
testAddedToList1, testAddedToList2 and a tearDown
method which cleans up the affects of the setUp method.
2) keep the same test methods but invoke the method in each test method

I'm also having problems with test dependencies. For example, I have a
create, retrieve and a delete methods. In order to test that the create
method is working I have to use the retrieve method. In order to clean up
after I need to use the delete method.
Any of these could fail but I'm only testing one. If create does fail
retrieve can't be tested because I need create to work to add test data to
retrieve. How do people usually get over this?
thanksThomas
